Review.Titre: Researched endlessly, Still Lied to and Cheated!
Review.Contenu: Researched, read reviews, kept looking for wifi hotspot provider, which Tello claimed they would provide.  Their map claims to have good coverage where I was.  It sucked!  Not just a little bad, horrible.  I could compare it to other wifi in coffee shops, et cetera, and it still sucked.  Away from a little town--almost nothing.  I had continually tried to impress upon any Tello representative that wi fi hot spot was my priority.  Always heartfelt promise of not just good or acceptable service, but rather the best!!!!   Not true.  Any and all promises now from Tello are subject to the most stringent scrutiny.  They have all drunk the kool-aid.  More BS from yet another rip off phone company.

Review.Titre: Customer Service rep didn't read the responses I gave, kept asking cookie cutter questions that didn't suit the problem
Review.Contenu: Poor interaction. Representative asked for an order number, there wasn't one I could see. They didn't understand the issue and gave a standard response instead of an appropriate one. They then find the information later and no longer request the order number, then they ask for the error message after already having provided it to you multiple times. Then throughout describing the issues I was having they kept answering the same unhelpful answer, showing they didn't actually listen to the questions/info I was asking about. They then kept asking the same question instead of actually reading the response. Then at the end it was frustrating to ask for this survey multiple times, and instead being told to call in about the issue, then was told I asked about the order number ('Order' was the first word of the error message, but never anything about an order number) when the transcript shows I never did.Just please, for the love of god read the responses, and answer. Especially when I'm already doing what you ask. But if I have to explain the same thing to you multiple times because you can't get it the first 2-3 times... not even using different words, just copy/pasting the exact same error message. It's frustrating and makes me feel like you do not care about the customer in the least. You're putting zero effort into the interaction. The whole point of contacting Tello was because the other carrier said Tello was denying the request, there was nothing more they could do. Understand that I'm just trying to get to the bottom of it.EDIT: "We noticed that you were able to port your number successfully, the rejections were due to the incorrect port information provided on the request itself" - INCORRECT. The port request was successful because I altered my Tello address multiple times with false/different addresses in order to finally get the porting to go through. It wasn't that I needed to correct the address in there, it was that the address in there wasn't working, as I tried telling your representative multiple times. Even copying and pasting and ensuring no errant spaces/characters were present. I had to put in bogus addresses until one worked.

I wrote the following review on the tello blog page titled ("What you can actually do on 2g") , original review below. It was not approved so I left it here for others to be aware of what to expect. Actual 2g speeds are indeed usable. However, the recent testing done on the tello network of the throttled data once 4g data was exceeded left me completely dissatisfied.2g provides data transfer speeds between 64kbps and 256kbps with good reception. Using the tello network speeds were observed to be maxed out at 30kbps (0.03mbps) when the signal strength was the strongest. The testing was conducted over the course of 7 days in multiple areas with signal strength reading between -63dBm and -99dBm at testing.My observation is tello throttles data much below the standard 2g network, making their service very much unusable once data cap is reached.

Review.Titre: Will your phone REALLY work on the Tello network?
Review.Contenu: In determining if we should switch our service to Tello, we first checked to see if our phones were compatible with their network.  We used THEIR IMEI system checker on their web page, (home page linked to "bring your own phone"), for all of our phones.  It indicated all our phones would work, (both Apple phones and my wife's Android Galaxy A12), but...not so much.  First, it took a full week to get the SIM card for the A12.  the iPhones were eSim eligible).  Once we ported over to the Tello network, we had difficulties making calls, receiving calls and sending/receiving texts so finally we called Tello.  They informed us that our Samsung Galaxy A12 wouldn't work on their network even though their web page says it does.  Their response from customer service was to hold on to the phone and wait for an update from Samsung, and that many customers who have the A11, A12 and A13 are having problems with the Samsung updates making the phones work with Tello. Really! And what am I supposed to do until then?  The Tello agent also agreed that their site should say that the Samsung Galaxy A-12 is not compatible.  Now that we have ported over all our phones from our previous service provider, which worked fine with our phones to one that only supports 2 of our three phones is very disappointing. We switched over to save money, but is it worth it? Time will tell, but now I have low confidence level in Tello.  I feel it is a poor and deceitful business practice on Tello's part, especially the flippant attitude of "oh well, wait for an update or buy a new phone".

Review.Titre: Deceptive marketing - "Unlimited" has a 25 GB limit
Review.Contenu: Deceptive marketing.  Company advertises plans named for their amount of high-speed data, in all cases but one.  So, there's a 500 MB plan, 1 GB plan a 5 GB plan, 10 GB and "Unlimited."  They even promote it as "Unlimited EVERYTHING --For Real...".  However it has a limit of 25 GB of high-speed data.  So, if they were honest, they would call it the 25 GB plan, consistent with all their other plan names.  They are not honest.  The limit on the "Unlimited" plan is disclosed only in smaller print at the bottom of an interior page of their website.   Shame on them! "Unlimited Everything" is a lie.They have s sleazy tactic for clouding the issue:  You get unlimited 2G data.  But 2G data and high speed data are two different things.  They do not give you unlimited high speed data, so "unlimited everything" is a lie.2G data will not get you access to the Lyft app for example.  All the other plans are identified by their amount of HIGH speed data. And then they call this plan "unlimited". And yet the fine print contradicts that by imposing a 25 GB limit on high-speed data. Very deceptive! And apparently intentionally so.I provided this phone to a refugee living in a shelter without Wi-Fi. She needs lots of data because she's having numerous Zoom calls with various aid agencies and she was given a credit for Lyft that she can only access by the Lyft app which uses high-speed data only. She has two small children with various medical needs. She hit the 25 GB limit which we didn't know about just when she needed to access the Lyft app in order to take one of her children for medical care. We couldn't figure out what was wrong.  Finally I called Tello and discovered that "unlimited everything" to them means 25 GB of high-speed and no more. After much argument they allowed half a gigabyte additional but would not honor the promise of "unlimited everything" They also would not let me talk to a supervisor.I'm done with Tello but would like to save others from being cheated in the same way so I am posting this on Trust Pilot and have filed a complaint with the attorney general.  A half truth is a whole lie and lying to consumers is against the law.

Tello randomly blocked my texting service saying I am using it for business not residential purposes which is an outright lie. I am disabled and do not work!. They tried blaming T mobile but that was proven false to me. Despicable

UPDATE #2Spoke with FCC today who instructed me to file a complaint. The form had a place for attachments. Went to Tello’s website to take a screenshot and noticed that some minutes had been used. Wanting to be sure that my phone number was still not working, I tried making a call again. To my surprise, it was now working. I want to thank Trustpilot as I believe they were instrumental in resolving this issue. Also want to thank Tello for finally getting my phone working again. To be fair, Tello provides unequaled service AND pricing. They have an awesome website to manage your account. For instance, it allows you to see the Number called, Date & Time of the call,  how long the call was, and the Cost of the call. However, the best part of their website enables you to customize the service plan you want such as the number of minutes and MB. Doing so gives you the lowest price possible. You can also choose not to have a plan and select Pay As You Go. Since I do not know which option is best for me, I have a customized plan for one line, and the Pay As Yo Go for the second line.END OF UPDATE #2UPDATEIn my review, I had 2 issues. 1) The first and most important one of all was that after adding 300 minutes by renewing, I was unable to make any calls or receive message as it showed "Call Failed". 2) The second issue was about eSIMs. Received Tello's reply that only addressed the second issue regarding eSIMs. They glossed over the first issue about the phone being unable tø make or receive any calls. Tried calling using that line and it is still not working. If line isn't working in 2 days, I'll lodge a complaint with the CPUC. Additionally, will seek the advice of legal council to ascertain if this matter can be litigated for actual and punitive damages. I've had this number for 15 years and have missed many costly calls and messages.                       END UPDATERenewed a plan. However, when making a call now, it shows "Call Failed". Renewed my plan for another Tello number which worked fine. Have spoken with 4 argumentative representatives who were of no help whatsoever. One told me to shut down my iPhone and would call back in 5 minutes but never did, which is a common occurrence. Another representative said there was a problem with my phone. I’ve spoken with this particular person many times in the past who ALWAYS says the problem is on my end no matter the issue. He refused to escalate this matter. I asked to speak with his supervisor and was transferred to an answering machine. Left a message but again, never received a call back. Another representative told me to take the phone to an Apple Store. Another representative put me on hold to research this issue. He returned 10 minutes later stating 2 lines cannot be  on at the same time. It’s been a week now and the number still doesn't work. There is another issue which has been unresolved for 2 weeks . . . it no longer supports 2 Active (ON) lines. Although I have 3 SIMs, all phones only have the capability to have 2 Active (ON) lines at the same time. With 2 Active (ON) lines, this allows a person to make or receive calls on either line. However when doing so, it puts the other Active line on Standby mode until the call is completed. This feature works with a 3rd party SIM card and an eSIM as well as using two eSIMs.I’ve spoken with 5 representative regarding this issue. All adamantly state that my phone is incapable of having two Active (ON) lines even though I’ve been able to do since day one using their service. This feature works with a 3rd party SIM card and an eSIM or two eSIMs.Spoke with Tello’s main competitor Mint Mobile. They acknowledge that my phone is capable of having 2 Active (ON) lines simultaneously. The pricing for their plans is competitive. Unlimited calling/text with 5GB is $15. Tello has the same plan for $19. Since Mint Mobile has better pricing with knowledgable  good-natured customer support representatives, the choice for me is clear . . . No more Tello nightmares!!!

Review.Titre: Price is good, service is not
Review.Contenu: Switched from Republic Wireless to Tello, and immediately started having problems. When making calls, it takes forever to connect and start ringing, then when it finally does, calls frequently drop. Texting is a nightmare. I have to turn on my own data most of the time to send and receive, or turn off my phone, then when I turn it back on, texts flood in, some from days ago I never received. The only time texting works properly, is when I’m texting with my brother who also has Tello. I’m about at the end of my rope, I’m switching back. I’ve tried everything Tello Customer Service suggested, but I still have the same problems. Good price, but not worth the unreliability.

I wrote review and they contacted me and asked my information and now they replied on my review and says they can't find my information 😂 even I gave them all my detail and my phone number. Thisbtime I am providing my order number i hope this time they can find my information.

Review.Titre: Its been more than 3 months I am facing…
Review.Contenu: Its been more than 3 months I am facing no network issue they told me samsung will launch new update this month but didnt got anything.My phone is new with latest Android version but my other phone is galaxy s10 plus which has android 9 i dont understand how both phone can have same issue if its really software issue?Clean sim card restore phone update phone turn on off phone all this just time waste truth is their service is sucks and they can't fix issue they even don't know what is the real issue is they just making stories and scamming with people I am looking better service. Be aware of them

While on 2G data,(1) Dialing a call takes around 1 minute to find the caller and hear the ring on both side.(2) On 2G data, App based mobile data messaging does not work.(3) Google Maps service does not work, just like a dead, so it does not show any direction when you are lost.

Review.Titre: Despite the coverage map saying that…
Review.Contenu: Despite the coverage map saying that there was excellent service in my area there is actually none at all. I live in a suburban town just outside a major city and the service is actually non-existent. I tried speaking with customer services but they fobbed me off with the same excuses, "there's a cell tower down in your area, no we don't know when it will be repaired, the service is actually only supposed to be intermittent." In short, Tello is a complete waste of time and money. Avoid at all costs.
Not receiving text messages and regularly have to reset network connections.

I've given one star but zero would be preferred. I can't really say anything good about them to be honest since I barely even managed to connect to their network! The SIM came through the post after almost 2 weeks of waiting, I had pre paid so the money left my account immediately and I worried the SIM wasn't ever going to appear (such was the lack of communication) . When it did, I put it in the phone, it worked for a day and then refused to activate.I contacted support, they kept feeding me total rubbish about a new Android update affecting activation and I ended up giving up on them after 3 days of no service and no help. Switched to US Mobile, worked first time, up and running within an hour. Sadly, Tello gave me nothing to love about them and they never refunded my money. Worth the money? I feel almost happy to pay to be rid of them!Addition:I can confirm that my money was returned, though I cannot see a good reason to raise my rating. No one would wait 3 months for an Android update in order to get cell service (as I was being asked to do).

I have had a terrible experience. According to their website and according to one of their representatives my phone is compatible with Tello Network and I'm in a good coverage area. I have not been able to make a phone call or text or receive a phone call or a text since starting the service. The tech support was not very helpful after the first few calls. I would call and nobody would be there to answer the phone. I would not recommend tello to anybody who actually wants to use their phone. In response to Tello's response to this review...I already included my order number and telephone number to you.Tello tech support had no  answers for me so I cancelled my account and received a refund.

Review.Titre: Worse service I have ever seen
Review.Contenu: Worse service I have ever seen. All the time no signal at all no matter where you go if you have emergency soeey you'll be without signal no call or text. Last whole month I tried to contact them and all replies of my email was clean sim card reboot device update software restore phone change networking settings thats all they said and at the end they said issue is under one more thing they said Dont Use 5G lol I pay for 5G why not? I am still waiting i dont know when it will resolve if they don't resolve this issue by end of this month I'll disconnect servicei don't wanna pay more for nothing goodbye

If there is a zero stars, would have selected that.I moved to tello based on trust pilot reviews, 3 days after moved to tello, both incoming and outgoing calls not working. My mother is in hospital, supplied my number for every place. Chat option not working, customer service call never connect and disconnect automatically after 5 mins. I sent an email, then reply says more customers are complaining about it and no timeline on resolution. ** Issue is not resolved even after 14 hours of complaint although lot of customers are facing the issue. ***If phone is critical for you, stay away from tello.Update: Issue resolved after 18 hours, but I was completely stuck, lost time, had inconvenience and pain.

Total rip off. Paid them for a phone, they sent a SIM card. Next, they said they "had to investigate"...still waiting for my MONEY BACK. They are clearly only concerned about THEIR side of it, and not at all concerned about the guy who is OUT A HUNDRED BUCKS. Anyone who deals with these incompetent clowns is a FOOL. In their response to this they claim to have never lied to me...yet they SAID they had shipped me a phone. WHERE IS IT, THEN?

After they switched to GSM , I have troubles. Customer service responds quick, but they have some basic templates written on the troubleshooting steps which they keep on insisting and is not helpful at all. Calls going automatic to voice mail, not receiving SMS ever after turning on the data services. I have three services two of them I already terminated. This review is very genuine, I have entered my order # for further reference.

Service is lousy. Most of the time my phone tells me "Emergency Calls Only" and won't let me make regular calls or texts. Seems to me, if the phone is capable of making an emergency call, it should be capable of other calls as well. It also often shows that I have several bars of service, but text at the top of my screen says "No Network Connection", and of course my phone won't work. Internet is terrible too. Tello is cheap, and I suppose you get what you pay for.

Multiple problems with this MVNO.* Hardly got any network coverage and wifi calling just wouldn't work. However, they do have a great app and you can use it to place calls over wi-fi. * Also, group texts just DO NOT work!! I had a computer engineer friend (from Stanford!) take a look at the phone and they recommended that I was better off switching telecom providers.Can't wait to move on.

Review.Titre: I got my phone stolen and afterwards…
Review.Contenu: I got my phone stolen and afterwards they would not re-send me the security pin.  Just give me the birthing pin so I can activate my phone.  All these "security" features are just awful and they don't get to know you either, it's always a different person to deal with.  They act as if the security pin on a civilian phone is a matter of national security or something.

Review.Titre: Calls drop people can’t hear me I miss…
Review.Contenu: Calls drop people can’t hear me I miss calls.

Don't answer phones.Did not tell me to Purchase a phone with a sim card slot for the change of network happening in one year.My other phone carriers phone was dropped accidently and I needed internet but tello's internet was down for hours.I waited 2 hours outside for a taxi that never came and tello's internet still down the next day.

Review.Titre: Disappointed by frequent inability to connect and by call quality
Review.Contenu: I switched to Tello about six months ago because I like the price and the billing process.I have experienced repeated call failures, however.  And even when I am able to connect, the audio signal often is garbled.  Perhaps this is due to my Vermont location (I don't know)-- but I DO know that my repeated inability to make routine calls is unacceptable.As a result, I will be replacing Tello with a different carrier.

Review.Titre: Phone service over past few months has been inadequate
Review.Contenu: Phone service over past few months has gotten horrible. Calls drop all the time, and when on calls,there are times no reception- can't hear caller, or at points, they can't hear me. So disappointing. I use to recommend tello  all the time. Tickets do no good either. Some of us, based upon our plan have become a low priority.I will be shopping.

I upgraded to the new chip for tello and I have no service in areas I had service and only one bar most others. People can not hear me often saying “ I can’t hear you you’re breaking up…” Very disappointed. Tello Support called me and they were very nice, turned on wifi calling, which helps a little with calls while I am home, but still have all the same problems! Especially dropping calls constantly! Like 3 drops per call and long periods of time with No Service!

I purchased Tello value 6 -month plan ( $44) through online and activated ( 11/02/2021  ) and had to ported out my number (11/17/2021) to other carrier for  an evitable reason. I requested for a partial credit for keeping Tello account . But they refused it for $44 .Thank you Tello for your inconsideration.

Review.Titre: Not so compatible as you said
Review.Contenu: Converting three phones from two different carriers to Tello.  Each was verified as compatible.   Purchased three Tello start up kits.  Each failed for different reasons, no SMS, no signal where map says great signal, etc.  Many hours were spent on each conversion.  Original phones at original carriers worked fine. Super price but got what we paid for. Massive frustration.

you are changing operating systems. and did not inform us of said change. leaving us with spotty service and constant dropped calls for two months, the only reason we found out we were going to lose service on our old phones is i called to complain about the bad reception. and the kicker is, we would have had no phones in a few weeks. i feel it is bad business to not inform your customers of terminal changes to their service. basically you left us high and dry.

Was trying to switch from other carriers... but won't be. Tello seems to have good service coverage and a reliable network. But fails on account support. I have never seen a company make it so difficult for onboarding new customers to use their platform or have more than 10 lines with them (anyone else would welcome the extra business).@ Tello you should really look into the onboarding process of your competition because your process is VERY inefficient. And It could use a serious overhaul. Also, where do you post/state there is a limit of 10 lines??? It is not transparent. "residential" or not, I've never seen a company so willingly shoot themselves in the foot to decline potential business or extra revenue from a customer.

I don't like the auto renewal process. It doesn't roll over the balance. Spam and robocalls aren't screened at all. too many of them. promotional rates are only for new customers once you are locked in, they don't pay attention to existing customers. No roaming.

Review.Titre: No working service for 3 days with no end in sight
Review.Contenu: You can't talk to their tech department, only customer service. I move my service to them and so far (3 days) no working service. I get the run around from customer service, they miss dead lines (i.e. we will respond in 1 business day) they set. Their only solution is to wait with no timeline. While I have no phone to conduct business.

So I really wanted this to work because the coverage is as good as my previous carrier but costs less.  But I kept having calls dropped.  Various people, times, days, essentially everywhere, anytime and anyone.  So, I had to give it up, went back to former carrier.
Very poor reception. I often have to hang up and redial. My service bars still show I good reception but the quality of the call is not as indicated.

Review.Titre: The service is horrible where I live on…
Review.Contenu: The service is horrible where I live on both of my lines, the website is difficult to navigate, unlimited data means that my Spotify should work without WiFi when I cycle .... Wrong ! If your service isn't good in an area you should tell people. You get what you pay for.

Data Plan and pricing is great on paper, however, in the field it's below average. Mobile data speed is always lagging and gets throttled down depending on the day and the time. The only reason I remain a customer is due to 90% of my connectivity is with WiFi.

Getting to live customer  Customer Service is  an act of total frustration on the Tello website. Type in the address bar Tello/customerservice/support/ that will get you a  live person. Customer service at Tello 3 years ago was fabulous. Today its a monkey cage, with no humor persons heavily monitored expect quick answers, Questions like how much GB am I using  or is my iPhone 128 enough or do I need more memory? Gets a. quick disconnect.(most likely byTello management) . The. faqs. are where Tello management is headed- totally ..expect low to. average live service.  My suggestion   is get out while you can, as $$$$$ is Tello management's mantra.Save your self,   some  big frustration.

I have a customer of Tello since a year now. I have $10 Tello Dollars in my account but I cannot use it since:1) Tello does not allow it's customer to use Tello Dollars in automatic renewal method. You manually need to cancel your plan, wait for the expiration date, renew the plan manually and choose Tello dollars as the payment method.2) You cannot use Tello Dollars as partial payment. For e.g., if the plan cost is $20 and you have $19 as Tello Dollars, you cannot use it towards your plan. Either you have to refer someone else and get more Tello Dollars or buys cheaper plan for which charges + taxes is less than or equal to Tello Dollars.3) Tello does not work at all in Canada and Mexico. You are basically on your own.If Tello does not fix the above issues in few months/years, I will lower the star rating to 1 star.

Review.Titre: I used their service for about 2-3…
Review.Contenu: I used their service for about 2-3 years (twice I switched to them) because they were affordable, but also with good service. It was only until a few months ago from now, that their service started giving me a no signal, saying "emergency calls only" even though my service was active. I called customer service, they gave me a new sim, then it was fine for a few days. But, it went back to the same issue.... so I switched to t-mobile, didn't want to bother with the problems. I can't recommend unreliable service.

Review.Titre: The services Tello offers are AWESOME
Review.Contenu: The services Tello offers are AWESOME.  For Price versus value you have NO PEERS.  That said, your website isn't very good.  It is difficult to navigate and more awkward to find information than it could be.  But perhaps you don't spend very much money on web designers and technicians...and if so it SHOWS in the EXCELLENT PRICES and design your own plans that your company offers.  I give you 10 STARS for VALUE and FLEXIBILTY...the TWO stars is purely for your website.

Review.Titre: You can't change your Caller ID!
Review.Contenu: You can't change your Caller ID, they don't advertise this and it's a big drawback for business users.  Maybe it cost them something extra or it's a fraud prevention step?  It's a little unprofessional to be calling from "Wireless Caller" to business clients.

Review.Titre: No option to add services but only but paying for a whole new plan
Review.Contenu: There is no option to add data to a plan but only by paying for a whole new plan that includes it. My plan had just been renewed and realized I wanted additional data. Had to pay twice only to add data to my existing line. Hopefully you may add this option soon.

My Samsung phone started to lose network connection off and on two months ago.  Went into searching and/or emergency mode.  Tello ran me through many troubleshooting steps but that did not work.  They finally told me it was a Samsung software update that was causing the issue.  I called Samsung and they said it was a Tello problem.  Note that switching SIM card showed it was NOT a Samsung problem but a Tello problem and now I am getting ready to switch to another carrier.  I have emailed Tello support many times.

Review.Titre: Data used faster than it should
Review.Contenu: PROS: Good coverage based on the T-Mobile network. Renewal notifications work as described.CONS: Unlimited plan has a 25GB data cap that slows to virtually unusable 2G speeds when exceeded (most carriers falsely advertised 'unlimited' but 25GB limit is less than many other MVNOs). Data cap threshold consistently reached much faster than previous T-Mobile, Mint Mobile, US Cellular plans (i.e., Tello reports 25GB+ usage while phone has used 19-20GB, so it's actually only a 20GB plan). App & online account do not summarize data usage, so you cannot see real time data consumption. Customer service replies are prompt but scripted & do not address my questions, so will be moving to a different wireless provider.

Review.Titre: I'm being generous with this review
Review.Contenu: I'm being generous with this review.  We have had Tello for a week and a half.  We have had 1-2 bars at home, but when traveling between cities, we have no service.  Yesterday, we had no service from anyplace.  This was a cause for extreme anxiety for me since my mom is on our plan and has 3 people checking on her daily.  My brother was very worried because he wasn't able to reach any of us.  My adult son also has medical issues (severe depression and epilepsy).  He is an hour away.  We need to keep in touch with him daily.  This isn't going to work for us.  The price of Tello is great, but if you don't have service, that's a problem.  We are currently looking for another carrier.  Ugh!!

Review.Titre: Unlimited???  PONY TURDS!!!!  Not unlimited.  THROTTLED!  Unethical & deceptive business practice.
Review.Contenu: I suppose it's my bad. Inundated, shopping all the different carriers, looking for the best deal. Somehow I must have failed to read the fine print on this one.The practice of calling something unlimited, when it's not. I think is a pretty deceptive tactic. Not just on you Tello, but on all cellular carriers whom advertise UNLIMITED, when it is not unlimited. Only 25 gigs on this so called "unlimited" plan. Surpass that 25 GB & they knock you down to 2G speeds. Anybody remember 2G speeds? USPS, the freaking mailman, even he goes faster than 2G! 100% completely useless. It takes about 45 minutes to download a text only email @ 2g speed. Can't even pull up a map before you find the place without one. Took over 55min to access Tello's very own site, just to click a button & re-up our plan. Shouldn't call it unlimited, if it's not truly unlimited!  It's totally not necessary. All of you mobile providers already have us by the nuts. And y'all do it. I mean, what's the harm in calling it what it is & telling the truth?

Review.Titre: Good prices but the service acts up
Review.Contenu: Good prices but the service will often act up. I have unlimited texting but for some reason on the last days of my plan I can’t send or receive text messages.

Review.Titre: It took 3 tries for Tello to port in my…
Review.Contenu: It took 3 tries for Tello to port in my numbers correctly. However, I was impressed with the response time to address the errors.
Coverage is not as advertised.  I do not get a signal in places that I tested before buying this service.  I even did not have a signal as I approached Las Vegas on my recent trip!

Review.Titre: The only thing I can be thankful for is…
Review.Contenu: The only thing I can be thankful for is the help center, they tried to help me with my problem but there was no solution. I wish I had the opportunity to navigate with the data plan I bought but it was impossible.
Spotty service and dropped texts, can't send group texts or photos without buying data, offer credit to you to have you get others to join, but make it impossible to use the credits

Review.Titre: The cell reception is very patchy and…
Review.Contenu: The cell reception is very patchy and sometimes your phone would go "no service" on you in the middle of the city...literally in downtown. I also think that in general the service used to be better last year....Update: and now they are asking me to provide them more info...which I don't want because there is absolutely no point - it will not make my coverage better, but instead I would be engaged in a pointless conversation with tello people. If I don't give more info, they will take my review down. Let's say now I think I understand why Tello has such a good overall rating and mostly positive reviews.Update2: Tello flagged my review. Lol. Initially I wrote quite polite that the reception was unstable. How did we get here, Tello? I will be leaving you because not only you have below average service (which is undoubtfully affordable though), but you are flagging your customers..I mean, really!? Do you have to take down every review that gives you less than 5 stars?

Review.Titre: Though Tello is a very good service
Review.Contenu: Though Tello is a very good service, it’s payment options and the payment portal are confusing. It’s possible that this is deliberate to promote purchase of additional service. This has been consistent throughout my experience with the TELLO payment portal for 2 years. I am always anxious when I use it.

Review.Titre: Tello actually cost me $225 for just 3 months
Review.Contenu: I paid $32 for 25gb data.  The speed and reliability was great,  as was signal. They say they slow it down once you use up your 25gb of high speed.  They suuuuure did!  Even right under a cell tower with 5 bars I couldn't use the internet.  Page loading simply stalled out.  It was 100% totally useless.  Pay for ANOTHER 25gb and it works very fast again. I also never went through data so fast as what they said I was using.  I believe they are very inaccurate with your data usage. I always was spending at least $65 a month using Tello. After 3 very disappointing months  that cost me  $225 to use Tello I switched to T-Mobile Magenta plan.....100gb HIGH SPEED ALWAYS....for $50 a month.

A few months ago Tello changed to a new network.  Since that time my service has been terrible.  Dropped calls and text that never go through.  The good thing is that it's so cheap I'm willing to live with the poor service.

Review.Titre: My phone has never worked from outside…
Review.Contenu: My phone has never worked from outside of my home. (And I use my land line when I am home.)I reported the problem but all they do is Email the entire instruction book to me.  I have tried dozens of times over the past year to make my my phone, (Which I purchased from Tello.), work.I am an old man who only needs a cellphone for emergencies. The price is great,, unless you need to use their service.I did get a call. The man was very nice but he told me that my phone would not work on their system. He had me move back and forth from 4 to 5 on the service. This did not work. ---------------------------------------------------December 2022.Later I thought, "Why not try 2? It worked! I can now make a call from my car. Service is a bit slow but I don't need fast service.I guess level 2 is for people who over-use their level.I got it working but I still can't register my phone. That won't matter unless I lose it or it is stolen so I can live with it.

Review.Titre: Spotty coverage and many phones not supported even if they say it is
Review.Contenu: I have an unlocked Note20 that Tello said was compatible. Unfortunately, it could never receive a single inbound call. After many support emails over a period of days - all the time being told Samsung Note20s don't work on any T-Mobile service (not true because it works fine on Mint) - I was finally told my phone was NOT compatible. Additionally, the coverage was terrible - maybe this was because my phone wasn't working with their service. I lost service constantly and I'm in Atlanta. Finally, I'm not a fan of their customer service either. There is not chat support or phone support. It's all email. Now I will say this, in most cases you get an email response within minutes or hours at most.
data is really slow, i have unlimited data but its not worth the price

Review.Titre: I switched to Tmobile for $35/mo unlimited data/phone/text at 5G. If you use internet/email Tello is a joke.
Review.Contenu: I had the $10 plan with 1 mb of data which was used up in an hour and had to switch to unlimted data plan for $30 but they limit data to 25MB and then switch you to 2G which takes 10 min to load a webpage so I switched to Tmobile for $35/mo unlimited data/phone/text at 5G. If you use internet/email Tello is a joke."What we recommend would be to make sure that you update Apps over Wi-Fi only and restrict App background Data. You can also set a daily usage limit for Data in your phone's settings." Ok but I don't have to do all this with T Mobile so Tello doesn't make sense for me.

Just switched over and not able to receive calls from people that have always called me and that I call.  Very frustrating.Even after working with customer service, still not able to receive calls on the same network that I came from - TMobile.  Can't even receive calls on WiFi calling.  Tello showed that my phone was compatible with their 5g but then customer service said it was not.

Review.Titre: I tried to use my Tello Dollars to pay…
Review.Contenu: I tried to use my Tello Dollars to pay yesterday's bill manually but I couldn't find an option to do that. After seeing that I had paid the whole amount with my credit card, I contacted customer support and they explained me the situation. I still think it is too confusing.

I'm having a horrible experience. I'm not able to view anything, not even my account information. I have no way of making sure I can make sure my next month will be here! I'm so upset. I need HELP..Please

Review.Titre: Service has been very poor last few…
Review.Contenu: Service has been very poor last few months.  Way too often get notice that carrier has temporarily cut off service.  Often takes 2-3 days for text messages to go through and phone very often not available for voice.  We had a big field fire this week with husband severely burned and unable to call for help.  Will likely be changing soon.  Loved the service when we first got it.  Disgusted now.

Review.Titre: Reception is very poor at my house…
Review.Contenu: Reception is very poor at my house despite being in the city.  I can only use WiFi calling.  Despite being able to get strong signal in some areas of city, I can’t get but 1 or 2 bars of cell strength in others which makes it bad if need to make emergency call.

Review.Titre: I can’t get voicemail to work no matter…
Review.Contenu: I can’t get voicemail to work no matter what

Review.Titre: We love the price but not the reception at our home
Review.Contenu: We love the price, but we have to work to get some texts to send. We try different things: go outside, turn off the WiFi on the phone, set the phone in certain places in the house, or wait to get/send texts until we drive away from our house.  Distressing when you need to send/receive texts immediately...

Review.Titre: Network Change -> No Signal in my own Apartment
Review.Contenu: I have had tello for several years now and was always a big fan. When they switched networks recently, I started having issues with service - even at my own apartment! People try to call and it goes straight to voicemail. I will need to switch to a new provider which is so sad because you can't beat the price point Tello offers.

okay service, LTE/3G only network, no 5g access to T-Mobile's network if you use iphone. Free international calling doesn't include Hong Kong and Macau. For the same data allowance and features(5G access, free international calling) I would rather go for redpocket's 8GB/month annual plan($240/yr vs tello's 4GB $19/month). Oh, and also no reception if you are in Alaska because tello doesn't include domestic roaming. Good luck.

I've been traveling lately, both domestically and internationally, and I've realized how limited I am when it comes to coverage. Tello doesn't offer roaming, and it took awhile to figure out how to activate wifi calling on my phone for my international trip, and you're a sitting duck if you don't have Wi-Fi. And good luck traveling in the Midwest on a road trip. We were nearly stranded in the middle of nowhere of NE on our way west. No roaming meant no gps as we were driving. but we only knew this after the fact when our next leg of the journey was constantly "recalculating". Not sure how sustainable tello will be for me as I aim to do more traveling in the future.

Your price is right, but you've removed services that I used to enjoy. Now I have to go out across the street in order to send and receive text messages because you no longer support WiFi transmission. Boo! I am looking for another service provider.

Review.Titre: Tello was great as long as they were…
Review.Contenu: Tello was great as long as they were using Sprint simm cards and piggybacking Sprint towers. Since it is all Tello simm cards now and I'm not sure whose towers, Tello is not bad enough to abandon but not good enough to recommend.

Review.Titre: This seems to be a classic example of…
Review.Contenu: This seems to be a classic example of "you get what you pay for."  The low price is fantastic, but the service has been extremely unreliable, even with respect to text messages.  I will be dropping this service in the next few months in favor of something more reliable.

Review.Titre: An Economical Plan for those who stay in places with good coverage
Review.Contenu: Tello provides low-cost mobile service but without roaming, I often don't have coverage.  Customer Service has been excellent in the past, but I fail to understand why the migration to the GSM SIM is an upgrade as now I have trouble setting up my voicemail that I had in the past.  I appreciate what Tello provides, but it doesn't seem to meet my needs any longer.

Review.Titre: The service offered meets my particular…
Review.Contenu: The service offered meets my particular needs at this time...... However..... I had to order a phone to comply with gsm requirements only to learn a cdma phone with VoLTE works as well....And the phone tello sent was a cdma phone without VoLTE (LG Tribute Monarch refurbished Boost Mobile phone for $119)...and i had to return it..... Tho the experience was educational....i dont think it reflects well on tello service.....

So Far service is ok.  I had to upgrade a plan and was forced to pay the entire amount after only having service for 2 days.  I also lost my 20% promotion for the 1st 6 months on that line.  Also Unlimited is not really unlimited.  You get 25 GB and then are throttled down.  LOL, you 2g is useless and you know it.  You reply is insulting.

Internal speaker did not work.  Don’t you check this stuff out before selling it?EDIT: Customer service did contact me.  They asked if I wanted a refund or a replacement phone.  I asked for a replacement.  After returning the phone, they sent me an email indicating there was no replacement phone available. (why offer one then??).  Anyway, I do appreciate them contacting me.

Prior to the change to a GSM sim card, the service was good.  Recently after the change, my pictures to and from my phone won't go through most of the time.  My call quality has also deteriorated.  Calls either drop or when I am on them i can't her people or they cannot her me.  I am using a Iphone 6s and had no issues with other carriers on this phone.  I do like the plan options and low price, but guess the say you get what you pay for is right.

The price is great but the robo and telemarketing calls are horrible.  You can expect when you get a new number to get calls from the previous owner for a month or so.  I have had this tello number for several months and the robo calls are coming stronger than ever.  I think tello sells your information to these telemarketers that is why the price is so low.I have blocked over a hundred phone numbers and text message and I still get robo call trying to sell me stuff.

Review.Titre: Good Customer Service, Bad Cell Service
Review.Contenu: Tello customer service was always very helpful, but it didn't make up for the fact that the cellular service was never close to functional.  I'm in a small town with historically bad T-Mobile/Sprint coverage and, after 6 months of trying, when I switched to another carrier who uses AT&T networks, my phone worked immediately.

Yes, it is cheap, but it has seriously started to fall short of my expectations. My service has started to be very poor almost all the time, and I can no longer send or receive pictures over sms, send group messages, or use my voicemail properly. All in all I used to love tello for the price but now I’m seriously considering spending a little more so I can actually use what I am paying for.

Review.Titre: Tello was very good when I started with…
Review.Contenu: Tello was very good when I started with this service. Then things started to go downhill after that. My calls are dropped more and more often and it is getting worse as time goes on. What is happening Tello?! A loyal customer who is disappointed with a good service that is not so good anymore. Hope you can fix the problem.

Switching was my husband’s idea. I would say calls and texting has been good ONLY if you are in the somewhat limited coverage area. My main issue is with the internet… it completely sucks. It just doesn’t work. I can’t rely solely on my home WiFi, I am not always home. We have been stranded multiple times on the road because we can’t access waze. I am seriously considering reverting to my previous service provider. With that said Tello is good on a budget and I guess you get your money’s worth.
Service doesn't work at times.  Can't receive texts or phone calls for no reason when there are enough bars for proper functioning.  Only just started having problems in the last month or 2.

Review.Titre: I often receive texts much later than…
Review.Contenu: I often receive texts much later than when sent. Sometimes my texts sent are not received. I have a hard time hearing conversations clearly, and people complain they can’t understand what I am conversing, very often repeating. I purchased the LG phone from you.I will be purchasing a new phone soon and discontinuing my service with your company. I saved money while with your company but have to go back with Verizon.

Review.Titre: Greedy Prepaid Policy Change Not Good
Review.Contenu: Tello used to be great now not so much. There is now  prepaid mininum spending of $20.00 every 3 months. If no order is placed in 3 months your prepaid credits will expired and your service will be terminated. Why can Tello allow people to spend based on what people need and not set a high minumun prepaid order in a short 3 months duration period. Not good at all.

Review.Titre: $6 plan and $4.15 for taxes.. really?  & you dont mention it till you switch.
Review.Contenu: $6 plan and $4.15 for taxes.  Of which there are all kinds of categories.  It would be nice if Tello would give you an idea of the total bill vs $6 as a plan. You would expect taxes to be around 10 - 20% max.  This is around tax.  It is close to being unethical.  Deeply disappointed.  Will be with tello since I paid a tranfer fee etc. But, it's not a company that I will stay with.

Your techs don’t know a lot. Should be better trained. Your signal is weak  where I live. All Sprint network services are. I will probably be switching to Spectrum and spouse deal with less data. It’s sad that a Sprint tower is not far from where I live but the signal is just too weak. One to two bars is not enough. Calls get dropped all the time.

Dropped calls.  After several attempts of failed instructions, all what I am left of with is that "there are issues technicians are working in your area".  When asked how long will take Tello has no idea.  So basically no solution, no set expectation.  Very disappointed.  For several years I was happy but now no more.

The service seems great.  However the network constantly drops out or will quit when you're in the middle of a search.  Would love it if they had a better network and way of keeping the service up for data usage.  Phone calls always go through, so the only real problem is with the data dropping out.

Review.Titre: I am very disappointed with the cell…
Review.Contenu: I am very disappointed with the cell coverage of Tello.  My phone drops calls and has very poor service whenever I leave the Chicago area.  If I am supposed to be on the Sprint cell towers, something is seriously wrong because when I am traveling with other people who are on Sprint, they have no issue.I love everything else about Tello, and I would love to be able to recommend it but unfortunately, I don't feel safe traveling with this service and have to consider switching to another carrier.

Review.Titre: Sometimes I won't be able to received…
Review.Contenu: Sometimes I won't be able to received email or text message until the next day and also text to my daughter and friends and they won't receive it until next day. A lot of time I have one bar signal on my phone. My daughter said they received multiple same text messages since I text only once. I hope tello.com can improve better.

Phone drops to "No Network Available" too often.  Receive no notification of this other than incoming calls go directly to voicemail, inconveniencing caller, and I know nothing is wrong until I attempt to call out to see the message.  Have to reboot phone to fix.Charger connector on refurbished phone was faulty.  Tossed it and use Samsung charger that came with my Notebook.

Review.Titre: I ordered a phone and purchased a…
Review.Contenu: I ordered a phone and purchased a service plan for my son for Christmas.  I was having trouble activating the phone and when I called I was told there is no service in my area.  Since I had the phone for more than 30 days I couldn't return it (as I stated, it was a Christmas present so it was bought early).  I wish I would've been told there was no service in my area prior to spending almost $100

Review.Titre: I use To be their biggest fan not pleased this time
Review.Contenu: I have really been please with tello until this experience they first sent me a new phone that wouldn’t activate them they sent me another phone that would not activate and i finally ended up having to buy a used phone which activated fine. As good as my previous experience has been this was really bad went for a long time with out a phone then took weeks to get a refund

Review.Titre: the alcatel flip phone I got is junk…
Review.Contenu: the alcatel flip phone I got is junk quit working1 day after 30 day warranty. now it shuts down will not start up till I remove the back take battery out and replace have to go outside to get a signal constantly loses signal just junk.price is reasonable for service but this phone is junk. I am 64 I cant afford any other service so I will stay with tello just wish the phone would work .thanks jeff

Review.Titre: Excellent to make calls here in…
Review.Contenu: Excellent to make calls here in Baytown, Texas, but no 4G coverage. Hope Tello run on Tmobile network soon...                                                                                           Downgrade to 2 stars because lately international voice service is horrible. Phone calls to Mexico drop over and over again. Tonight I realized is a Tello problem 'cause after 2 dropped calls switched to Google Voice and the call went without interruptions. Im a loyal customer and would like Tello stand up and fix this issue...

For more than 1 year period, I have had more than a few calls that never rang on my phone in the 1st place & were not even registered as missed calls & text messages that were never delivered to my phone when family/friends texted me on my phone. I called tello technical support & the phone was re-set several times but did not fix any problem.Now, tello has suggested that it might be an issue with my phone & that a factory re-set or buying a new phone could solve the problem.

Review.Titre: It is difficult to discern issues.
Review.Contenu: It is difficult to discern issues - is it a problem with Sprint or Tello.The difficulty with international calls (Europe) are taking us and our business / church / family relationships to exploring other venues. Altec has surfaced as a viable vendor.Sprint's lack of service in the north and northwest is unacceptable.

Review.Titre: Don’t bother calling their customer…Don’t bother calling their customer service line, nobody will answer it. They don’t call you back so don’t bother leaving a message. The email responses were prompt
Review.Contenu: Don’t bother calling their customer service line, nobody will answer it. They don’t call you back so don’t bother leaving a message. The email responses were prompt but appear to be partially canned responses and so we’re confusing. After many exchanges, they did resolve my problem.

Review.Titre: I am disappointed with how often phone…
Review.Contenu: I am disappointed with how often phone calls and texts are completely unavailable to me. And my data use to be available away from wifi, but lately I get NO INTERNET is spite of having plenty of remaining mbs.When I ask you guys, you tell me to reinsert my sim card but that is not the problem. The problem is you shut me down for many hours in a day and often I absolutely NEED to make a call or text but the screen just says no service or schedule this call for some other time. So If I could get a reasonable explanation for this or a work around that actually functions, that would be nice. Otherwise, I'm changing service providers soon.

Review.Titre: My calls are regularly dropped and my…
Review.Contenu: My calls are regularly dropped and my phone data  just doesn’t work sometimes when I leave my house WiFi. The data times out or is super slow…Love the price, but service needs work.
I can't use data.. so I pay for something that I don't get. But low price you expect cheap service.

i thought its nice to change my phone number, that way no one will call me unless i tell them my new phone number, but i was wrong, so may calls and numbers that i don't know keep showing on my phone, when i call Tello, they pretty much told me, they didn't know why, i really didn't like the answer from them!

Review.Titre: i have had trouble with getting data…
Review.Contenu: i have had trouble with getting data service outside my house going on 2 months now. i have a moto z and i thought it would be a good phone but not. i should of gotten a i phone instead. would like to trade it in for one! i cant open any photos or data service.need to be fixed. before i came to tello they said i would have good service and it lasted one month now i cant trade my phone in for a new one because it only had a 30 day warrenty which they didnt tell me. never had such bad phone service and horrible warrenty on a phone before!!

Review.Titre: Price plans are good but with Tello…
Review.Contenu: Price plans are good but with Tello piggybacking off SPRINT the service isn’t good. The 4g is lousy, it keeps stopping on Google map or other road finding app specially when your driving. You loose the signal. Also you cannot switch caller ID off. It remains on at all time.

Very poor service, always losing connection, especially at the most critical times! It is a rare luxury when i can have a normal conversation on my cell from start to finish without the reception waving in and out. I know it's dirt cheap but a little bit of service would be nice.

Review.Titre: Techs have been unable to resolve issue…
Review.Contenu: Techs have been unable to resolve issue with telephone not receiving incoming calls. I called myself after setting up service and the call went through but have not been able to get any other calls since. I have been issued a ticket number and told to wait 24 hours but issue still not resolved. Called again and go through all steps again and then told wait 24 mores hours. I did not receive an email or anything so I called back again and am told to wait another 24 hours while they contact the main provider again! I've been patient but really frustrating!

You started off great then, as you launched your promotions, the service got worse and worse.  The tower malfunctions with every weather disturbance, you no longer have the bandwidth to support your subscribers here during busy times, the hotspot keeps going down when being used...   I know you are working very hard to correct this but I can't afford to keep you as my main internet connection.  I will keep you as a standby and possible backup because I like your CS reps. immensely but, if you don't get on top of this soon...you're screwed.

Review.Titre: Data seems to take a long time
Review.Contenu: Data seems to take a long time to do anything, im comparasion to my brother's provider. we both have the same phone and and his apps just connect much quicker and respond better.  Voice is fine, text is fine just data seems to be slower than average.

Got the service for a cheap plan for my 10 year old daughter. Spotty service and number I was given has numerous debt collectors calling and still get texts from previous users contacts. Called to see about getting assigned a new number and was told no. I guess you get what you pay for.

Okay service, but no roaming (a real big problem when I'm overseas!), no rollover of unused data, minutes; and not as cheap as it seems with auto recharge hitting every time you go over your data amount.  Probably wouldn't go with them again, planning to switch back to Sprint.

Service has been fine, but I had horrible issues with purchasing phones from them in the beginning.  I still have the unusable phone they sent me.  I stay with them because they are the cheapest I can find.  Also, they sent me a request to review them, so I'm just being honest.

Accessing help and technical support took 4 hours. 3 of your people answering technical support questions in the chat did not give out the most basic information of how to set up the phone. the answer to the question that all of them should have known is to skip through the Google screen skip skip skip until you can access the phone's settings. In the settings, you then reactivate the phone through the Samsung note 9 phone settings. Train your people to see what the customer sees. If I can't activate with you having already ported it over to you, then I'll just port back from you.

Review.Titre: Don't Let Your Automatic Billing Card Expire!!
Review.Contenu: Although I have been pleased with Tello's service, it is useless should you forget to update the credit card information they have on file when it expires. You will not be given notice; they will simply cut you off and, instead of allowing you to simply update your billing information, you will be required to sign up for a new plan as if you were a new customer! A HEADACHE which could EASILY BE AVOIDED if they SIMPLY SEND YOU A TEXT informing you that they were unable to bill your card. This is an EXTREMELY INEFFICIENT manner to do business, but a great way to waste your customer's time.
International calls always get disconnected for every 5 min. Can’t receive local messages or calls in-spite of being in coverage area.

Review.Titre: Pay as you go is no longer a good option
Review.Contenu: Pay as you go is no longer a good option at Tello. The minimum is now $20 (+taxes) for 3 months which is around $6.67/month - so you are better off with a plan. But the lower priced plans have higher taxes than the higher priced plans. So you might end up paying more for some lower priced plans than higher priced plans.If you subscribe to Pay as you go, then you need to track the expiry date yourself. The online account does not show the expiry and there is no warning. The balance on your account is just gone - as happened in my case. If you have any balance, you cannot get it refunded or transferred. You just lose it.

Review.Titre: its not really a simple 14 dollars a…
Review.Contenu: its not really a simple 14 dollars a month, taxes are added on which isn't the biggest  deal.  but the tale is in the truth here. custom service is blahsay. just like any other.. expect to get what you pay for. would I recommend these guys... most likely no

Review.Titre: Tello is cheap and the Service is…
Review.Contenu: Tello is cheap and the Service is sporadic. Has weird cut off of conversations if they thinkThey go On for Too Long. Had repeated cut offs when speaking  ro friend in Canada. All Tonight all Of a sudden downgraded to 3G service which is awful- nextTo nonexistent with trying to access information/emails.Guess you get what you pay for. My planJust renewed 09/22/2019. By Oct. I was downgraded to 3G. Very weird about sending texts as well. When I am notOn Wifi, text transmission. Is frequently not delivered.  Am thinking about switching servers again Because service is problematic.

Review.Titre: Tello doesn't stand behind their products that they sell or their service.
Review.Contenu: My husband's phone doesn't work.  You won't fix it.  My minutes and data don't roll over.  We purchased our phone through Tello.  I think they should fix it or provide an avenue for it to be fixed.  I think that a company that sells an inferior product and doesn't stand behind it provides a poor quality of service.  How can we continue our service with Tello when the phone won't work?  Tello called after my review and talked to my husband and told him they would not fix the phone or provide any avenue for it to be fixed and cancelled his account.

Tello made a promise that 5G would be available by now. Still stuck on LTE on the iPhone even months later. I’m essentially paying the same price as those who do have it but for less performance. Very upsetting.

Review.Titre: You get what you pay for: very weak signal coverage on older phone
Review.Contenu: I understand that often in life "you get what you pay for"The signal for out daughter's phone has been highly disappointing.  Text messages are nearly non-functional [except when connected to wifi  -  which we could do without subscribing to Tello ofcourse].  The phone signal does work, but, again, very spotty coverage.I also understand that she is using an older device [iphone 6], but when I used that same phone as my primary device prior to handing it down to her, I did not have these issues when it was connected to operate on another network [with a higher pricetag].So, in short, going back to my opening salvo, this truly appears to be a case of "you get what you pay for"

Review.Titre: The coverage was not as good as AT&T
Review.Contenu: The coverage was not as good as AT&T. They changed my plan without noticing me, and even unchecked my option so that they did not notice me by email 48 hours prior to charging me. Still leave a 2 star since it is probably still one of the cheaper options.

Review.Titre: Since Tello is using t-mobile as a…
Review.Contenu: Since Tello is using t-mobile as a provider, reception is spotting, calls are dropped, and at many times I cannot even get or make text or calls!!  I would NOT recommend Tello to anyone now. Get rid of t-mobile.

Review.Titre: Unless you live in a large metropolitan…
Review.Contenu: Unless you live in a large metropolitan area, the coverage is sub par. It says I would have great coverage but that wasn’t true. I would almost rather pay $15 more dollars a month to go back to Verizon. In the end, you get what you pay for, which is not much.

Their customer service is terrible, they just copy and paste possible reasons for my issue instead of answering my specific question. We emailed back and forth a dozen times, and each time they just copied and pasted the same "possible reasons." They offered a 3 way call to solve the problem, then backed out. They offer a 24/7 customer support phone number that never picked up when I called. I was without phone service for 17 days thanks to them. After finally getting everything resolved, my phone service has been fine and it is the cheapest plan we found, so that's why I gave them two stars instead of just one.

I have not been happy with the service.  Connections have been much slower and I no longer am able to get voicemails.  Sorry to have to report such a low rating, but if you can find a way to assist me, perhaps the next review will be more favorable.Regards,

The pricing is good and the Tello service and online account is easy to use.  However, with the phone number we were given, we constantly receive, often inappropriate, texts and phone calls.  It is inconvenient to constantly block phone numbers.

Tello was great until we purchased new phones a few weeks ago.  My husband and I now have super spotty service, calls drop often, no visual voicemail and group texts no longer come in on one string.  Super frustrating!

Review.Titre: Generally I don't get great service…
Review.Contenu: Generally I don't get great service with Tello, which is true both in New York city and throughout New Mexico where my family live. It's really hard to make a call without it dropping and sometimes getting any data is impossible as well.

Review.Titre: A Good But Unreliable Service From Home
Review.Contenu: The cell reception around the Phoenix area where I live is generally good and I enjoy the service. As soon as I travel or go 100 miles from base my service goes from 4G to E (edge) and basically I can do nothing. Eg I spent a fortnight in New York and had little service. Same thing with Chicago, San Diego, Philadelphia etc. Basically it's unreliable and I always need a backup. I've complained and all they do is ask me to set my APN to something else. I have reset my network setting so many times to no avail. I have used other networks and never got this before. Anyway that's me, I can't tell if this happens to others, but it's not a service I can always rely on. I read recently Tello still uses the Sprint network, don't k ow if it true but it's a shame.

Installed Tello's T-Mobile sim cards to my iPhone 7Plus and iPhone SE which are both LTE/Volte capable (confirmed with Apple) only to find out that both phones drop from LTE to a 3G connection when placing voice calls with poor quality and slow data speeds during placed call. I live in a very strong signal area in Queens NYC. Also constantly receiving pop-ups if I want to update cellular network settings which I agree to however does not resolve issue. Tello's technical support unhelpful falsely claiming that their is a tower outage or blaming Apple phone for not having VoLTE (disproved by Apple) or congestion drops calls from LTE/VoLTE to 3G. (Never had 4G call anywhere).Disappointed customer.

Very cheap plans. Fast customer support but they mislead you and do not provide complete information. I had bad experience in porting out my number. They also do not offer WiFi enable calls and that’s major drawback of Tello.

Review.Titre: My phone does not work as before.
Review.Contenu: Many people inform me that they call me and I do not receive the calls.  sometimes people they do not listen to me o I do not hear them for moments during a call.  My phone take fotos of my face and add it in videos. Would you please help about it.  Thanks in advance.

Review.Titre: I love the tello realistic pricing…
Review.Contenu: I love the tello realistic pricing however customer service is hit or miss,I had one tech say my table isnt compatible with tello when of course it is the techs ego wouldnt allow him to admit he was incompetent, that type thing.I can deal with inconvenience to get the good price my wife cant.

Not quite through my first month of service. The Service was Excellent! HOWEVER, December 5th, they decided to change up all their plans. Specifically, they increased the high speed data, however, they got rid of the 64kbps fall back. While the additional high speed data is nice, lack of the 64kbps fall back means, when you run out of data, your done. No more working service. You can't even get online without another data source, such as wifi, to top off service if you need more. We were testing out with an ipad, and were planning to add 4 more ipads and a phone at renewal time, and more in the future, however, having no working data at all is a deal killer. So this brings my 5 star down to a 3.As a poster on reddit puts it, and summarizes it quite well:"Before: blow through 500mb, no longer able to browse, but still able to send an occasional WhatsApp text, control the IoT intercom door lock and parking gate, activate a bus ticket etc...After: blow through 500mb, have 500mb more, blow through that as well, stuck without ANY data for the rest of the cycle."
getting paid every 2 weeks does not jibe with 30 or 31 days renewal

Review.Titre: At the very first two years ago when I…
Review.Contenu: At the very first two years ago when I enroll tello mobile, I had six gigabyte data and unlimited talk. I was able to complete a month little short, the later I upgrade for 10 GB. I almost finished about 7/8 GB still run couple of GB end of the month. Then I was switching for unlimited gigabyte data supposed to get a 25 4G, now only 25days  finish all my 4g data, even though most of the time especially night times I use my home internet. I just could not believe something is not right at the beginning was very good now looks like they're slowing down intentionally then you must upgrade.

Review.Titre: Reception occasionally spotty in Northern Maryland
Review.Contenu: Reception occasionally spotty in Harford County Maryland.  Many times have not received calls that should have gone through. Instead they went direct to voicemail.  Calls such as acknowledging appointment in doctors office, etc.Otherwise fairly few dropped calls or poor quality of sound.
Obviously the price is right for me and my needs. Phone service is not very good, low coverage outside any major city limits in the state of Oregon currently. Internet speeds vary greatly

All works fine, but: "Unlimited" data turns out to be limited to 25GB. A few minutes after sim activation, I was bombarded by scam calls and they keep calling. Apparently they selling phone numbers to scammers.

reasonable Service,  Great customer support, bad, Payment gateway,  Hacked my prepaid card. Great value if you dont get Hacked, 2 seperate accounts same thing both. use paypal no problems.Come on ! requestion every piece of information just to process so trustpilot wont  delet me  YOre Kidding !

Phone call connection: Not good - frequently the service cannot deliver the phone calls at first time though it is in an area with excellent coverageUnused data: Cannot automatically carry over.Data plan: Good - can choose an option based on need

One problem  I have is when I am home listening to commercial radio on wi-fi usint ootunes app,I am getting dharged data bits/bltes. I have veen retired  22 years and have to limit my expenses. Have I got my iPhone 13 configured wrong and charged for wi-fi?  Ken

Links to make payments is not obvious. I had to edit my payment method and the links did not tell me that it was or wasn't accepted. When I had not gotten an email confirming changes, I then resubmitted. I had to use another device to make upgrade because mine had been shut down. It would be nice if there was a way to keep paying account open.

Review.Titre: I have been a user of Tello for 2 years…
Review.Contenu: I have been a user of Tello for 2 years now. I do appreciate the service but I do now see the price to benefit ratio falls behind compared to other esim providers and as a user am a little sad to see this happen.

The service isn't s reliable as I would like. There are times when long text messages just won't send even though pics will send with no problem. Most recently my hotspot repeatedly quit for a couple of hours especially high speed though I only started a new billing cycle and need it most.I do enjoy being able to change your plan freely but it is weighted hevaly on data.

Review.Titre: The step to transfer my original phone#…
Review.Contenu: The step to transfer my original phone# was not clear. When a new sim was inserted, my old service was deactivated and all existing phone info was lost and hard to transfer. For 2nd phone, there's no confirmation to be activated successfully.

I find the only thing that is missing international roaming. We can make a call using the app while we are roaming but cannot hear voice mail or access messages. It would be great if at least these features were added.

Many of my outbound calls, especially to businesses, are of poor clarity...the voice transmission on my end is badly distorted. If the party calls me back on their phone system the clarity usually improves markedly. Is this annoyance a Tello matter?

Review.Titre: My Experience with Current Tello Services.
Review.Contenu: Generally, good service.  Customer support tends to be good. Coverage, not so much.  I've had issues with coverage areas that I didn't have with my previous service provider.  Only discovered the coverage issues when I was outside my home area, and needed coverage owing to a vehicle problem.  Now, I try to be more careful of where I roam, and whether I have coverage, or not.  Rating would have been higher, had I not had coverage issues.  Thank you.

Review.Titre: Tello provides reliable service at an…
Review.Contenu: Tello provides reliable service at an incredible price. My only disappointment was during my trip to Alaska last summer, where I learned that state is not covered.
Internet connections are badWould like to use it while on the beach, but its outmore than half the time...However for what Tello charges,no complaints
No complaints with the service itself but auto-pay is not optional. For those of us with a pre-paid debit card, it translates into a couple days of confusion and frustration every single month.

Review.Titre: cant  ever  get a  signal in my house …
Review.Contenu: cant  ever  get a  signal in my house  have to be outside and 30 feet away/ good thing i only use it to get  my password codes

Tello is cheap, but it was difficult to activate and my friend has trouble hearing me when I call. My texts also sporadically fail one or two times a day for 10 or so minutes. It's unsafe if you were to ever need it for an emergency tbh.

Review.Titre: I guess you get what you pay for?
Review.Contenu: Well it's not bad for the money.But beware, it can be spotty coverage in places.

Review.Titre: I Love the customer service and I love…
Review.Contenu: I Love the customer service and I love the affordable plans. What I have a small issue with is in certain parts of my city I dont get service or if i go close to far out i will loose signal.

Review.Titre: While I appreciate the ease of use
Review.Contenu: While I appreciate the ease of use, when I asked to change my plan I simply had to forfeit what I had already paid in order to change the plan. Not hot on being double billed.

Review.Titre: Activation took a long time whereas I…
Review.Contenu: Activation took a long time whereas I wanted it instantaneous. While the plan mentions unlimited, speed got reduced drastically lost 25GB consumption.
Dislikes - Frequent disruptions in service or not getting text messages from people in a timely manner.  Likes - cheap price and decent customer service.

Review.Titre: Affordable service...if you can get it.
Review.Contenu: Affordable service...if you can get it.Tello is one of the most affordable prepaid plans around. It works well when I'm in or near a town. On the rare occasion I need to travel, roaming between towns is almost non-existent. Get what you pay for I suppose. The other star it lost is for the hassle to get data to rollover. If you let the plan renew automatically, you lose the remaining unused gigabytes from the prior month. If you renew manually, the unused data rolls over, but you lose the remaining days on your plan. The only way to not lose days or data is to renew manually between midnight and whenever that morning the auto billing system runs your account. This is an enormous PITA! I never had any previous service providers pull this kind of BS. Again, you get what you pay for. Otherwise, the service has been fine. It's just the corners they cut are more than mere inconveniences.

Review.Titre: Prices are not competitive any more
Review.Contenu: Prices are not competitive any more. The other providers are offering better deals.

They charge you to change plans before your plan is up. You lose any days you have already paid for on current plan. Update to Tellos reply. I had to wait to change the plan which meant remembering and checking the day to get more days use. Yes I am Frugal.

Review.Titre: I don’t like that you have limited…
Review.Contenu: I don’t like that you cover limited territory only in the US, you don’t support Mexico

I give tello 3 Stars because I don't like the fact that if your data that they give you for the unlimited plan reached the ending sicle your signal turns extremely slow, I think it should be unlimited as it is with the calls and texting that way every one comes to tello, because Tello would be the best since is doing better then anyone else the prices are perfect and the service is unique but is only that little detail that I wish they would have or change because this is why every customer gets frustrated with every company since they do the same thing just give them a serten amount of data for videos and Internet. I'll say if you change that you'll be the best telephone company.
I like Tello, especially for the price. Coverage seems to be spotty, but it works fine at my home; so I keep it there as a house phone.

Review.Titre: my call drops or cuts out
Review.Contenu: my call drops or cuts out. but the bars on my phone are showing more than half

Review.Titre: Unused data should be transferred to next month
Review.Contenu: Any unused data should be automatically transfered to next month.
The cell service is spot it cuts out data service fails in place. For the price I paid it’s what I expected.

Review.Titre: Extend the plan automatic renewal time
Review.Contenu: The update time of the plan is from 12 am to 4 am every time. Should it be until daytime, even if it is 7 am?
